name: 2017 International Conference on Control Engineering and Artificial Intelligence
content: 2017 International Conference on Control Engineering and Artificial Intelligence (CCEAI 2017) Jan. 13-15, 2017 University of Malaya,Kuala Lumpur,Malaysia Website: http://www.cceai.org/ CCEAI 2017 aims to cover a wide range of topics in the intersection of Control Engineering and Artificial Intelligence and to provide an effective platform for discussions between the academic and industrial researches and applications. Apart from sessions that will present new research results, tutorials and special sessions will be offered as well. Papers describing original work are invited in the general fields covered by CCEAI, with an emphasis on the topics listed below. Publishing and Indexing All the papers will be peer reviewed by 2-3 experts. The review result comes out in 20-30 days. If the paper needs revising, the revised copy should be submitted again for peer review. All the accepted papers will be included in the conference proceeding, which will be indexed by Ei Compendex, CPCI, Scopus, IET and other academical databases. Selected papers with great extension will be recommended to publish in international journals. Speakers: Prof. Loo Chu Kiong, University of Malaya, Malaysia Prof. Sameem Binti Abdul Kareem, University of Malaya, Malaysia Prof. Bipin C. Desai, University of Concordia, Canada Prof. Mariusz Giergiel, AGH University of Science and Technology, Poland Papers are invited to submit to CCEAI 2017 in the following (non exclusive) topics(for more topics: http://www.cceai.org/cfp.html): Artificial Intelligence Control and Automation AI Algorithms Adaptive Control Artificial Intelligence tools & Applications Automated Guided Vehicles Bioinformatics Natural Language Processing Control theory and applications optoelectronics CAD Design & Testing Estimation and Identification Computer Vision and Speech Understanding Factory Modeling and Automation Data Mining and Machine Learning Tools Fault Detection Fuzzy Logic Flexible Manufacturing Systems Heuristic and AI Planning Strategies and Tools Fuzzy and Neural Systems Computational Theories of Learning Submission： 1\. Prospective authors are invited to submit full-length, 6-page (max) papers in two-column formats including diagrams and references. Authors can submit their papers as PDF files through the online submission system：http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cceai2017 2\. You can also choose to submit your paper directly to cceai@apise.org Contact Us : Crystal Chang (Conference secretariat) email:cceai@apise.org Tel: +852-30506939
